snippet: The downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 rippled across multiple continents, bringing home in vivid relief the consequences of a struggle that had seemed far removed for many.
abstract: Downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 in Ukraine ripples across multiple continents, illuminating consequences of struggle in country that seemed far removed from many; news of plane being shot down spurs confusion, anger, grief and disbelief, as well as charges and countercharges of who was responsible; American intelligence agencies believe missile was shot from Russian side of border, and separatists say they brought down plane themselves.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Keith Bradsher and Chris Buckley from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia; C.J. Chivers and David Montgomery from the United States; Nicola Clark from Paris; Thomas Erdbrink from Amsterdam; David M. Herszenhorn from Kiev, Ukraine; Michelle Innis from Sydney, Australia; Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow; Michael S. Schmidt from Washington; and Sabrina Tavernise from Grabovo, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: The downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 rippled across multiple continents, bringing home in vivid relief the consequences of a struggle that had seemed far removed for many.

headline.sub: For Once-Remote Conflict, Jet Strike Is Devastating Turn
headline.main: With Jet Strike, War in Ukraine Is Felt Globally
headline.print_headline: With Jet’s Fall, War in Ukraine Is Felt Globally
